title: Amanda Keller breaks down at the ACRAs after winning Best On-Air Team for the Jonesy & Amanda show
text:
She took home radio's top prize at the ACRAs (Australian Commercial Radio Awards) on Saturday night.

And Amanda Keller was beside herself over the honour - winning Best On-Air Team for the Jonesy & Amanda show - backstage at the ceremony.

Speaking to News.com.au, the 57-year-old became tearful before explaining how much the gong meant to her.

'This just means the world to me': Amanda Keller (pictured) broke down at the ACRAs after winning Best On-Air Team for the Jonesy & Amanda show on Saturday

Amanda said: 'This just means the world to me. It's an energy boost and it means we're heading in the right direction.'

The radio star also said that she was grateful the show will continue for some time.

She said: 'I'm so grateful that we've got another few years, but it's funny, I don't like knowing what I'm going to be doing'.

Amanda said: 'This just means the world to me. It's an energy boost and it means we're heading in the right direction.' Pictured: Amanda and her co-star Brendan Jones

Taking to Instagram to share a photo from the night, she wrote in one caption: 'Wow!!! What a thrill... Best On Air Team at #acras2019. So proud of our team'

Taking to Instagram to share a photo from the night, she wrote in one caption: 'Wow!!! What a thrill... Best On Air Team at #acras2019. So proud of our team'.

The official Jonesy & Amanda account also shared several shots from the red carpet, congratulating Amanda and her co-star Brendan Jones.

They wrote: 'We're so honoured to be awarded Best On-Air Team at the #acras2019 Thank you!'

Woo! The official Jonesy & Amanda account also shared several shots from the red carpet, congratulating Amanda and her co-star Brendan Jones

Speaking on The Project after their win, Amanda said she and Brendan are like brother and sister.

She told the panel: 'There are some days when Jonesy is like a cheese grater on my face.

'It's like an irritating brother who presses a bruise constantly. It's a very fine line that we tread,' she added.
description: She took home radio's top prize at the ACRAs (Australian Commercial Radio Awards) on Saturday night.
authors: Marta Jary For Daily Mail Australia
